Internet search confirms this is a graduation program: Perplexity search result: The Productive Safety Net Programme (PSNP) in Ethiopia is one of Africa's largest poverty alleviation programs and has integrated graduation-oriented approaches. Multiple sources confirm that PSNP is explicitly linked with graduation objectives, both through its core implementation and pilot programs conducted in partnership with organizations such as CGAP, Ford Foundation, and BRAC. PSNP provides cash transfers and/or food transfers regularly to millions of beneficiaries[4]. Additionally, the program and associated graduation pilots emphasize productive asset accumulation, especially livestock, as a critical graduation criteria[3][6].
